sense.name: Be accompanied by a noise when moving or coming into operation.
sense.commentary:
INCLUDES: CLICK OPEN, CLICK ON, CLICK SHUT Syntax Is: NP1[agent] CLICK NP[patient] NP1[theme] CLICK PP
NOTE: The clicking sound results as a symptom of turning on or off operation but the emphasis is on the movment or start of operation of the object.
sense.examples: He clicked on the light. These keys have clicked open many doors. Harry wave his hand lazily and his record player clicked into action. The door to their bedroom clicked shut behind them. Several times, Chinese guards have pointed their automatic rifles at young children of U.S. diplomats and clicked the trigger.

sense.name: (cause to) make a clicking or ticking sound (repeatedly).
sense.commentary:
NP1[theme] CLICK (ADVP) NP1[agent] CLICK NP2[patient[concrete]] (ADVP)
NOTE: The movment is not what is emphasized in this sense, rather the emphasis is on the noise made.
sense.examples: John's alarm clock clicked loudly on his bedside stand. The metronome clicked incessantly. I clicked my fingers to the beat.

sense.name: Produce a vocalization, characteristic of birds.
sense.examples: No bird clicked or whistled now. The Bird clicked its laugh. "I have purposes, Garric," it said.

sense.name: Become clear or enter one's consciousness or emotions.
sense.examples: It finally clicked for him that college was not as easy as it first appeared. Calculus clicked for me my senior year of college.

sense.name: Become or be emotionally, positionally, or physically compatible.
sense.examples: They just clicked. Bryant and Bird clicked on an 18-yard pass play. We finally clicked together in bed last night.

sense.name: CLICK OFF: perform or finish an action rapidly.
sense.examples: The game was clicked off in 1:48.
